title: Max Bavin, bridge player and tournament director with a flair for problem solving – obituary
text:
Max Bavin, who has died suddenly aged 65, was a leading figure in the bridge community, serving as chief tournament director of the World Bridge Federation (WBF) and of the English Bridge Union (EBU).

He was born on April 3 1954 in Wigan, Lancashire, the son of Eric Bavin and his wife Constance, née Smith. He learnt to play bridge at grammar school, where he was fortunate enough to have a teacher who was an enthusiastic player. He was originally a chess enthusiast, but bridge soon took over once he had been introduced to the game.
